name: chat
content:

A2 to talk to someone in a friendly informal way: She spends hours on the phone chatting to her friends. We were just chatting about what we did last weekend. Whenever I walk in, I always find the two of them chatting away (= talking eagerly).

See more results »
A2 to take part in a discussion that involves sending messages over the internet, by smartphone, etc.: Use the app to chat and send photos free from anywhere in the world.
More examplesFewer examplesI'd love to stop and chat but I'm rather pressed for time.We were just walking along, chatting.Half an hour later, she was smiling and chatting as if nothing had happened.We spent a very jolly evening together, chatting and drinking.He soon nosed out the details of the accident by chatting innocently to people and making some phone calls.
